revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|en|enm|yester even}}, {{m|enm|yistreven}}, alteration of {{m|enm|yesterevening|t=last night, yesterday evening}}, from {{inh|en|ang|ġiestranǣfen|t=yesterday evening}}, equivalent to {{af|en|yester-|even|t2=evening}}. ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # {{lb|en|archaic}} {{synonym of|en|yestereve}} #* '''1820''', {{w|Walter Scott}}, ''{{w|Ivanhoe}}'', Chapter 15,<sup>[http://www.gutenberg.org/files/82/82-h/82-h.htm]</sup> #*: “Wert thou not in presence '''yester-even''',” said De Bracy, “when we heard the Prior Aymer tell us a tale in reply to the romance which was sung by the Minstrel? {{...}}” ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|yester-even}} ====Synonyms==== * ''see list in'' '''{{l|en|yestereve}}''' [[Category:en:Past]]
